comments:
I20070918-0010

While sharing a new project, I got an OOME that got reported in the log through SWT (hence my opening the bug against it instead of Team). I ran with 1Gb memory. The interesting consequence is that:
- no wizard showed up (expected);
- Eclipse crashed after a couple of clicks more (unexpected).

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space

If you're out of memory, strange things will happen in strange places. It's (a) likely to be nothing to do with SWT, and (b) undeterministic as to whether it will bomb or not.

Can you confirm the contents of eclipse.ini? It should have something like 

--launcher.XXMaxPermSize
128M

You could also try running it with -XX:MaxPermSize=128m since it's a Java VM.

Secondly, it could be that you have some bad plugins installed that are intern'ing themselves a bunch and thus causing the crash.

In any case, reporting it against SWT is probably case for resolving it invalid; but this URL might be useful to you.

http://wiki.eclipse.org/FAQ_How_do_I_increase_the_permgen_size_available_to_Eclipse%3F

Alex.

I only encountered this once so far, doing nothing special (beyond adding a project to CVS, which I do not do often), and opened the bug more with the intent to log the problem than anything else. I would contend though that with a mere total of ten projects open, with nothing special I'd know of in my configuration, which has run unchanged for months, this exception might be an indication of a new problem with eclipse itself - in this case, is anyone allocating more than in the past for the same actions as before?
I'll post again for sure if I can get more details.
It's not SWT and (sadly) there is nothing SWT can do about it (other than rewrite to use less classes).
